newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev dips, T-bill demand lends support.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev dips, T-bill demand lends support.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed at 1,667-1,672 per dollar on Tuesday, a touch softer from the opening's 1,665-1,670, as foreign currency supply dropped in late trade when most banks were out of the market.
* The lev has traded stable on opening levels for most of the day as investor interest in government securities ran high ahead of introduction of a currency board system, dealers said.

* Banks sold foreign currency for levs to buy discount T-bills, expecting a fall in the central bank main interest rate after a currency board arrangement was implemented from July 1 and the lev was pegged at 1,000 to the mark.
* The lev closed at 973-975 per mark, a touch firmer from 974-978 at the opening and in line with the international mark/dollar cross.

* Bids were received for some 61 billion levs at Tuesday's auction of Bulgaria's Finance ministry issue of 18 billion lev worth of four week discount T-bills. The issue was sold out at an average accepted price of 97.15 percent of par, yielding 2.93 percent to maturity.
* The central bank main interest rate is now set at 47.28 percent annually. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 91188
